messages: e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (16:29): what blender version should i d/l? i use mandriva 2006 on intel machine.
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (16:31): try the dynamic one with python 2.4
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (16:31): and whatis static/dynamic FFM PEG ?
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (16:32): it's a static or dynamic build which supports exporting to new video formats
67c6ac86469c4c89e5353d9ab624604a (16:32): yup, ffmpeg is an encoder library. under windows better known as ffdshow.
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (16:33): i am total newbie with blender. i need blender inplace of maya for a semester at college.
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (16:34): won't it be a maya specific course?
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (16:35): yeah,but the prof said we *may* use blender, so i am taking the liberty... would i have prob moving to-fro maya<-->blender ?
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (16:36): well, maby; some ppl complain that the interface is completly different
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (16:37): did you already play around a little with blender?
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (16:37): our prof says one need not be good at using features/interface but must know what he/she is doing and why,close to CG.
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (16:39): actually d/l 2,37a,did a right click and all screen was flooded with colorful lines, i thought it was a buggy d/l, so am d/l again.
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (16:41): possibly hardware lacking on my side...
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (16:41): you need good opengl drivers, blenders gui is made in opengl
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (16:41): how do i know if i have opengl drivers on my linux box??
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (16:42): look at the installed packages or sumthign, dunno, don't use linux
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (16:43): nvida or ati gfx card?
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (16:45): no clue there
a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (16:45): evenin all

a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (17:26): rohitsz: please post a bug in the bug tracker, including the blend file you were using when it rashed
a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (17:26): crashed
a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (17:26): rohitsz: actually, first, can you repeat the crash?
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (17:27): yes, but as the console putput reads, i guess blender is unable to find python!?
a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (17:28): unable to find python wont crash blender
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (17:28): ok... the same happened with 2.37a too.
a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (17:28): from the image you posted looks like an opengl issue to me
a7b9464a64d7a967c87d3acfcb5ec2e8 (17:29): but definitely post in the bug tracker, with clear steps on how you make it crash
e86fe1440f972f35b40b07d3298353a6 (17:29): as i had python,so i d/l "python-opengl"
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:38): Hi all! I am returning to Blender after a long time! How do I clear crease data from selected edge?
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:39): all i know is shift-e drag to edge
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:39): but there must be something else
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:40): well, with Shift-E I tried to set it +0.0, but the crease still shows!
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:40): can't help ya more then
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:40): maybe click "draw creases" :p
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:40): :) thanks anyway, Lekane
59638e7065b402c7d834d5ee73fbb594 (17:41): the reason the "+" is there is that the change is relative
59638e7065b402c7d834d5ee73fbb594 (17:41): a "plus zero" doesn't change anything
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:41): oh! that's news!!
59638e7065b402c7d834d5ee73fbb594 (17:41): a "minus one" will ;P
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:41): but, i did try -ve values too
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:42): isn't there a way, to just "clear the crease" ?
59638e7065b402c7d834d5ee73fbb594 (17:42): minus one should effectively set it to zero
59638e7065b402c7d834d5ee73fbb594 (17:43): it might be nearby edges that still have creases messing it up
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:43): it clear the crease when i drag to the edge here ePharaoh
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:44): well, it's not clearing here! :(
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:44): yep i agree with Alastain
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:44): and the edge is still being shown as yellow! (since draw crease is on)
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:44): btw, i am using 2.42
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:44): it disappears here....
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:44): same version
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:45): ah not same hehe
cfd59e07474ead5aade7440574e4c408 (17:45): but i dont think this feature was changed
a0ae1bdeac940c46922c5c00628ee948 (17:45): /decides to upgrade anyway

7304c1147594785b4c108234dd49438a (18:15): hi, how do I exit a single window mode? I've been trying that for 2 days without luck.
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (18:15): single window mode?
7304c1147594785b4c108234dd49438a (18:16): Auralis, like only one window is focused.
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (18:16): you want to have blender running like a standard window on your desktop?
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (18:16): or do you have inside blender only one large window?
7304c1147594785b4c108234dd49438a (18:16): Auralis, no.. now only one window appear.
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (18:17): crtl+left/right cursors
7304c1147594785b4c108234dd49438a (18:17): It should be simple to exit, I hit some keys by accident.
7304c1147594785b4c108234dd49438a (18:18): how do I assign some materials to some faces in a single object?
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (18:19): create the material, select the object an click on assign, or in edit mode, slect specific faces
